TEXT: The applicant is a NORP national , born in DATE and living in PERSON .
A.
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The applicant rents a flat in PERSON . The lease contains a “ negotiation clause ” ( förhandlingsklausul ) , according to which the rent is fixed following negotiations between the landlord and the local tenants’ union ( hyresgästföreningen ) .

On DATE the applicant applied , under the CARDINAL LAW ( hyresförhandlingslagen ) , at ORG ( hyresnämnden ) in GPE for a rent review concerning the rent for DATE agreed between his landlord ( a company ) and the local tenants’ union . The applicant claimed that the agreement was based on erroneous information and that , as a consequence , his rent was excessive and should be adjusted .
Preparatory meetings were held on DATE and on CARDINAL May and DATE .
On DATE a hearing was held before ORG . On DATE an on - site investigation and a further hearing was held . On DATE a final hearing was held .

On DATE ORG rejected the application for a rent review . On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal against the decision . However , on CARDINAL DATE ORG ) rejected the appeal . The court ’s decision was not open to further appeal .

In the meantime , on DATE , the applicant had instituted proceedings before ORG ( tingsrätten ) of ORG against his landlord , claiming that the negotiated agreement fixing the rent for DATE for his flat in PERSON should be declared null and void , or modified , in accordance with certain provisions of LAW ( avtalslagen ) . Furthermore , he claimed damages to compensate him for the work he had undertaken in order to obtain information about the negotiated agreement . Some parts of the summons application were left unspecified .

On DATE ORG requested the applicant to complete the summons application . He submitted the requested information on DATE . He then also applied for and was granted legal aid . On DATE the court requested the landlord to submit observations within DATE .

On DATE the applicant submitted further information regarding his legal aid . On DATE the court made a decision regarding the applicant ’s fee for legal aid . On DATE the applicant appealed against this decision to ORG ( PERSON hovrätt ) and claimed compensation for the work he had undertaken due to the decision .

On DATE the landlord submitted observations to the applicant ’s summons application , which on DATE were communicated to the applicant for his observations before DATE . On DATE the applicant requested , and was granted , an extension of this time - limit to CARDINAL DATE . On DATE the landlord submitted further observations and requested to be compensated for its litigation costs . The observations were submitted to the applicant for his opinion no later than DATE .
On DATE ORG reduced the applicant ’s maximum amount of legal aid and rejected his claim for compensation .

On DATE counsel for the applicant appeared before ORG and requested to be appointed as the applicant ’s official legal aid counsel . The applicant further clarified his claim under LAW . On DATE the request to have legal aid counsel appointed was granted by ORG .

On DATE the applicant submitted further grounds for his claim under LAW and his counsel requested to be compensated for litigation costs under LAW ( rättshjälpslagen ) . The request was returned for supplementary information . This information was submitted on DATE .

On DATE ORG dismissed , as a whole , the action instituted by the applicant , finding that the proceedings before ORG ( cf . above ) constituted litis pendens . The court also ordered the applicant to pay the landlord ’s litigation costs .

On DATE the applicant appealed against the decision to ORG . On DATE counsel for the applicant submitted further observations . On DATE the applicant himself submitted observations in addition to those submitted on DATE .

On DATE ORG quashed ORG decision of DATE and referred the case back to the latter for a re - examination . On DATE , noting that ORG had not dealt with the question of litigation costs , the applicant lodged an appeal with ORG ( ORG domstolen ) .

On DATE ORG granted leave to appeal and having obtained the parties’ observations it decided , on DATE , to modify the decision of ORG and quash ORG decision of DATE as regards litigation costs . The case was accordingly referred back to the latter court for a re - examination in that respect as well .

On DATE ORG accordingly requested the landlord to submit observations . On DATE the applicant requested to have his officially appointed legal aid counsel replaced . The request was communicated to counsel for an opinion no later than DATE .
On DATE the landlord submitted observations and requested that the case be dismissed .

On DATE the applicant informed the court that due to holidays , he would not be available until DATE . Furthermore , he requested the court to dismiss counsel for the landlord , on grounds of incompetence . On DATE counsel for the applicant submitted observations supporting the request that he himself be relieved from his duties as requested by the applicant .

On DATE the applicant was requested to inform the court , no later than CARDINAL DATE , of the name of the person he wanted as new counsel . On DATE the applicant replied that he would accept the choice of legal aid counsel made by the court . The court then made a proposal to him in that respect .

On DATE the applicant requested ORG to examine CARDINAL ) whether the landlord ’s counsel was unsuitable to serve as such before the court ; CARDINAL ) the question of litigation costs related to the first set of proceedings before ORG and ORG ; and CARDINAL ) whether the judge that handled the first case before ORG had correctly evaluated the evidence in that case .

On DATE ORG decided on the issues raised by the applicant DATE . The court rejected his complaints against counsel for the landlord . Furthermore , the court noted that it was not within its competence to examine how an individual judge had evaluated evidence . Finally , the court noted that it was not possible to examine the question of litigation costs in the superior courts at that stage of the proceedings since the issue was to be decided in connection with the determination of the case .

On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal against the decision concerning the request for dismissal of counsel for the landlord . ORG decided to stay the handling of the case in its principal issue , pending the outcome of the appeal . On CARDINAL DATE ORG rejected the appeal . On DATE the applicant appealed against this decision . On DATE ORG refused leave to appeal .
On DATE the applicant applied to ORG for a re - opening of the case concerning the request for dismissal of counsel for the landlord .

On DATE he requested to have a particular lawyer appointed as his new legal aid counsel . On DATE ORG granted his request to have his officially appointed legal aid counsel replaced by new counsel . On DATE the applicant ’s new counsel submitted documents stating , inter alia , claims and legal grounds . The landlord was requested to submit observations in reply before DATE . On DATE the landlord , represented by new counsel , requested an extension of the time - limit until DATE . The request was granted .
On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s request for a reopening of the case concerning the dismissal of counsel for the landlord .

On DATE the landlord ’s counsel requested , and was granted , a further extension of the time - limit until DATE . In its decision ORG notified the landlord that further extensions could not be expected . On DATE the landlord submitted observations . On DATE the parties were summoned to a preparatory meeting scheduled for DATE .

On DATE the applicant submitted further observations , which were immediately communicated to the landlord . On DATE the preparatory meeting took place . The applicant requested that the landlord be ordered to produce certain documents .

On DATE the court granted the applicant ’s request and decided that the landlord should produce certain documents by DATE . On CARDINAL DATE the landlord appealed against the decision . On DATE ORG decided to stay the handling of the case pending the outcome of the appeal . On DATE ORG rejected the appeal and extended the time - limit for the production of the documents until DATE .

On DATE the landlord produced the documents which were communicated to the applicant . On DATE the applicant requested that the landlord be ordered to produce further documents on penalty of a fine ( vitesföreläggande ) .

On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s request and ordered him , inter alia , to submit his final statement of evidence no later than DATE . On DATE the applicant appealed against the decision . On DATE ORG informed him that an appeal against the decision could not be made separately . The applicant requested an extension of the time - limit until DATE . The court granted an extension until DATE . On DATE the applicant requested a further extension until DATE . Emphasising that no further extensions could be expected , the court granted the request .

On DATE the applicant submitted further observations . He also submitted a statement of evidence and requested that a second preparatory meeting be held . On DATE the ORG summoned the parties to such a meeting scheduled for DATE . On DATE the court sent a written summary of the case to the parties , containing their positions , as the court understood them . The court directed the parties to finally determine their respective action and defence and to state what evidence they invoked .

On DATE the second preparatory meeting took place . The court then ordered the landlord to state , no DATE , the evidence to be invoked . On DATE the landlord submitted a list of evidence . On DATE the applicant was directed to submit his observations before DATE . On DATE counsel for the applicant requested an extension of the time - limit until DATE . The request was granted . On DATE counsel for the applicant requested an additional extension until DATE . Also this request was granted .

On DATE the applicant submitted his observations in which he made certain adjustments to his existing claims and introduced a new claim for damages . He also submitted a list of evidence . On DATE the applicant was ordered to clarify his position in certain respects no later than CARDINAL DATE . On DATE the applicant submitted the requested information . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s new claim for damages and directed him to determine finally his action and to state the evidence he invoked no later than DATE . In view of how the applicant had previously presented his action , the court notified him that after the expiry of the said timelimit he could not invoke any new circumstances or any new evidence , unless he had a valid excuse for not having done so earlier .

On DATE the applicant submitted observations . On DATE the landlord was directed to reply to the applicant ’s latest submission no later than DATE . On DATE the landlord requested an extension of the time - limit until DATE . The applicant was requested to state his opinion on the landlord ’s request within DATE . On DATE counsel for the applicant stated that he had no objection to the landlord ’s request . This was then granted by the court . On DATE the landlord requested a further extension until DATE . Also this request was granted .
On DATE the landlord submitted the observations and requested that certain claim adjustments made by the applicant should not be allowed . On DATE the landlord ’s request was rejected .
On DATE the parties , their respective counsel and several witnesses were summoned to a main hearing scheduled for CARDINAL , DATE and DATE .
On DATE the court sent a summary of the parties’ positions , such as the court understood them . They were given until DATE to express their views on the summary .

On DATE the hearing commenced in ORG . The applicant presented a new claim for damages based on the allegation that the court had violated his rights and freedoms . On DATE the hearing continued . The applicant ’s new claim was dismissed since it was not directed against the landlord . On DATE the main hearing came to an end and the parties were informed that the court ’s judgment would be delivered on DATE .

On DATE the applicant revoked his counsel ’s power of attorney with immediate effect . On DATE he appealed against ORG decision of CARDINAL DATE . On DATE he submitted a document claiming that the records from the main hearing were insufficient . On DATE the applicant ’s former counsel requested to be dismissed as official legal aid counsel . On DATE the court granted the request .

On DATE ORG pronounced judgment , in which the applicant ’s action as a whole was rejected . He was ordered to pay the landlord ’s litigation costs . On DATE the applicant appealed against the judgment to ORG .

On DATE the applicant applied to ORG for a restoration of the expired time - limit for an appeal against ORG decision of CARDINAL DATE to dismiss his , at that stage in the proceedings , new claim for damages .

On DATE he requested that ORG give his appeal suspensive effect , inasmuch as it concerned his obligation to compensate the landlord for litigation costs , pending the court ’s examination . On DATE ORG rejected the request .

On DATE the applicant requested ORG to refer the case back to ORG for a re - examination . On DATE the applicant raised the question of disqualification of all the judges on the division of ORG , to which the case had been assigned , and asked the court to remove the case from that division . On DATE the president of ORG decided not to remove the case .

On DATE the applicant requested that the landlord ’s counsel be dismissed from the case . On DATE he lodged an appeal with ORG against the decision of CARDINAL DATE , alleging that a grave procedural error had occurred . On DATE and DATE he submitted further observations .
On DATE ORG rejected the appeal against the decision made by ORG on DATE .
On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s appeal of CARDINAL DATE . The same day the court also rejected the application of DATE .

On DATE ORG directed the applicant to cure the defects of his appeal petition , no later than DATE , by providing information concerning the sought amendment of ORG judgment , the grounds for the appeal , the evidence invoked and the proof provided by each item of evidence .
On DATE the applicant appealed against ORG decision of CARDINAL DATE concerning the restoration of the expired time - limit . He also requested an extension of the time - limit .
On DATE the applicant appealed against ORG decision of CARDINAL DATE concerning damages for the alleged violation of his rights and freedoms .
The applicant ’s request of DATE for an extension of the time - limit was granted on DATE .
On DATE the applicant requested a further extension of the time - limit until DATE .

On DATE ORG decided not to disqualify the judges handling the applicant ’s case . On DATE the applicant lodged with ORG a notice of his intention to appeal against the decision . On DATE ORG decided that an appeal against the decision of CARDINAL DATE could be lodged separately , no later than DATE . The court also decided to stay the case pending the outcome of the appeal .
On DATE the applicant was granted the requested extension of the timelimit until DATE . On DATE he lodged an appeal against the decision of ORG of CARDINAL DATE .

On DATE ORG refused the applicant leave to appeal as regards his appeal of DATE against the appellate court ’s decision of CARDINAL DATE concerning damages for the alleged violation of his rights and freedoms .
On DATE the applicant submitted supplementary observations in respect of the directions given by ORG on DATE .
On DATE ORG refused leave to appeal against the decision of ORG of CARDINAL DATE .
B. Relevant domestic law

According to LAW negotiations regarding conditions for the renting of a flat are conducted between a landlord or a landlord and an organisation of apartment building owners on the CARDINAL side and an organisation of tenants on the other . If a lease contains a so - called negotiation clause , this means that the tenant has accepted the dispositions concerning the rent and other conditions that may follow from an agreement negotiated by the just - mentioned parties . This does not , however , entail any restrictions on the right of the tenant to request an assessment of the tenancy conditions by ORG . The size of the rent , when disputed , shall then be established at a reasonable amount . For this purpose the rent is not to be deemed fair if it is obviously higher than the rent for flats of equivalent utility value . A decision whereby tenancy conditions are amended by a tribunal supersedes the negotiated agreement in that respect .

According to the DATE ORG and Regional Rent Tribunals Act ( lagen om arrendenämnder och hyresnämnder ) the tribunals shall examine disputes concerning , inter alia , rents under LAW . Proceedings before the tribunals are in principle oral . Before DATE the decisions of the tribunals were appealed against to ORG . The court ’s decisions were not subject to further appeal .

LAW deals , inter alia , with the invalidity of certain legal acts . Section CARDINAL concerns the invalidity as a result of fraudulent deception . LAW deals with the situation where a person ’s distressed circumstances , lack of mental capacity , etc . , have been exploited by means of fraudulent practices . From such practices follow that the legal act is not binding on the exploited person . According to LAW the terms of a contract may be modified or set aside if the term is unconscionable with regard to the contents of the contract , the circumstances prevailing at the time the contract was entered into , etc .

According to LAW , LAW ( rättegångsbalken ) , which is applicable in the general courts , a party who is of the opinion that the proceedings in a case have been delayed without cause by a district court order , e.g. an order to stay the proceedings pending the outcome of an appeal , may appeal against that order separately through a limited appeal .
